intro: Euphrasia mattfeldii, commonly known as the Mattfeld's eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, bright yellow flowers with dark spots, resembling eyes, which give it its common name. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils and full sunlight. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it blooms from late spring to early summer. Euphrasia mattfeldii is often found in high-altitude environments, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
